title: A teenager‚Äôs death on an untamed island has put the spotlight on its inhabitants
description: The sun was still low on the horizon when 19-year-old Piper James walked toward the Pacific Ocean for a morning swim on an island whose name in the local language means ‚Äúparadise.‚Äù
fullText:
The sun was still low on the horizon when 19-year-old Piper James walked toward the Pacific Ocean for a morning swim on an island whose name in the local language means ‚Äúparadise.‚Äù

Within two hours, she was found dead, her body surrounded by dingoes, wild Australian native dogs that roam freely on K‚Äôgari, a national park famous for its natural beauty off the country‚Äôs eastern coast.

It‚Äôs not yet clear what caused the death of the Canadian backpacker, a young woman with an adventurous spirit, who had been working on the World Heritage-listed island for several weeks, fulfilling a long-held dream of visiting Australia.

Preliminary autopsy results found evidence of drowning, but also dingo bites inflicted before and after she died. ‚ÄúPre-mortem dingo bite marks are not likely to have caused immediate death,‚Äù the Queensland Coroner‚Äôs Court said in a statement.

‚ÄúOf course, we all want to believe it was drowning,‚Äù said her grieving father, Todd James. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs horrific, but maybe a little more peaceful than the alternative.‚Äù

Pathology tests to determine the cause of Piper‚Äôs death could take several weeks, but if dingoes are found to have played a significant role, it would be only the third fatal dingo attack in Australia in nearly 50 years ‚Äì and the first involving an adult.

In 1980, a dingo infamously snatched baby Azaria Chamberlain from her parents‚Äô tent in the Northern Territory. At that time, no one believed a dingo would take an infant and, despite her claims of innocence, the baby‚Äôs mother Lindy Chamberlain was jailed for murder. She was exonerated years later, when new evidence supported her story, inspiring a courtroom drama starring Meryl Streep.

The second fatality occurred in 2001, when 9-year-old Clinton Gage was mauled on K‚Äôgari, then called Fraser Island, by two dingoes who also attacked his younger brother.

‚ÄúThat‚Äôs when we started to see the fences being put up around the townships and the resorts,‚Äù said George Seymour, mayor of the Fraser Coast region that includes K‚Äôgari.

In the days afterward, more than 30 dingoes on the island were ‚Äúhumanely destroyed,‚Äù a decision that prompted public outcry.

A possible third fatality has put some in the community on edge. Not because of any change in the perceived risk ‚Äì which they know well ‚Äì but because they fear it could drive calls for another cull.

James said if dingoes are ultimately found to be responsible, Piper would not have supported a cull. ‚ÄúWe want no harm done to any animals over this, because Piper would not want that number one, and would be devastated to be any part of that,‚Äù he said.

Visitors to K‚Äôgari are warned of the risks, but James says young foreign nationals like his daughter, who work on the island, need firmer guardrails. Piper had told her parents that dingoes looked ‚Äúcute.‚Äù

‚ÄúThey look like her dog from home,‚Äù said James.

‚ÄúThose dogs, I said, ‚ÄòYou don‚Äôt touch them. You can‚Äôt touch them.‚Äô And she‚Äôs like ‚ÄòI know.‚Äô‚Äù

Around half a million people visit K‚Äôgari every year for its white-sand beaches, sparkling blue lakes and native wildlife ‚Äì including dingoes, or wongari, as they‚Äôre known in the local Aboriginal language.

Up to 200 dingoes roam the island, and while they look similar to their relatives on the mainland, their isolation from domestic and feral dogs means they have some of the purest dingo DNA. To Australia, their conservation is considered an issue of ‚Äúnational significance.‚Äù

While dingoes are treasured, they‚Äôre also acknowledged as dangerous.

Visitors to K‚Äôgari are warned to stay at least 20 meters from the animals, travel in groups, and keep children within arm‚Äôs reach. ‚ÄúDingo sticks‚Äù are provided to ward off those that get too close.

‚ÄúDingoes see people as a source of food, and that‚Äôs the issue, not people themselves,‚Äù said Ben Allen, a wildlife biologist who works for Ecosure, an environmental consultancy that did the last major review of dingoes on K‚Äôgari in 2012, though smaller ones have followed.

‚ÄúOver here, they sort of jokingly call it seagull syndrome, where you give a seagull a chip and then it wants the whole hamburger,‚Äù said Allen. ‚ÄúWell, these seagulls have got four feet and teeth, so you don‚Äôt really want to be feeding them a chip, because when it comes to ask for the whole hamburger, you can have problems.‚Äù

Tourists are urged to lock up their food and trash, and anglers instructed to bury any bait that may attract scavengers. Hefty fines are issued for anyone who feeds them or is seen to be encouraging their presence. Information guides warn visitors not to run, as dingoes will give chase.

‚ÄúIn the past, we‚Äôve told people that if you‚Äôre on the beach and you‚Äôre being stalked, you should go into the water,‚Äù said Seymour, the local mayor.

However, that advice changed after recent attacks ‚Äì including two in 2023, when a 10-year-old boy was dragged underwater by a dingo before his sister stepped in, and when a woman was attacked despite running into the surf to escape four dingoes. She was pulled from the water by two men and treated for serious injuries to her legs and arms.

‚ÄúI‚Äôve been saying for a couple of years that there is a risk of a fatality,‚Äù said Seymour.

On the morning of her death, Piper James had gone for a swim alone on the beach near the rusty hull of the Maheno shipwreck, a local landmark that washed ashore in a cyclone almost 100 years ago. No one knows what happened next.

‚ÄúWe don‚Äôt know if she actually went in the water,‚Äù said her father, Todd. ‚ÄúIf she did go in, there‚Äôs a good chance she drowned. She was a strong swimmer ‚Ä¶ But good swimmers get taken away all the time.‚Äù

Swimming is not advised on the island‚Äôs unpatrolled beaches and strong ocean currents are considered hazardous, especially along the eastern coast. Strong winds on Monday whipped up eight-foot (2.5-meter) waves, according to one resident, who lives nearby.

It‚Äôs possible James got into trouble in the surf before dingoes entered the picture.

James knows his daughter didn‚Äôt take a dingo stick with her ‚Äì because she didn‚Äôt think she‚Äôd need it.

‚ÄúPiper should not have gone. She made that decision to go. I just wish she‚Äôd maybe taken a stick, or not have gone at all. She shouldn‚Äôt have gone alone, that‚Äôs the bottom line.‚Äù

James said Piper loved Byron Bay and Bondi Beach ‚Äì other popular Australian destinations for beach-loving tourists ‚Äì but K‚Äôgari was a ‚Äúnext-level kind of experience.‚Äù

Scott Bell, the secretary of the Happy Valley Community Association on K‚Äôgari, has been visiting the island on and off since the 1960s, and understands its appeal.

‚ÄúIt‚Äôs a magical sort of place,‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúIt is a wilderness area. And in that environment, there are a lot of dangers, be they sharks, snakes, spiders or dingoes.‚Äù

Bell said his time on the island has taught him to stand up to dingoes. ‚ÄúYou stand tall, they see a large animal there, and they tend to run away,‚Äù said Bell. Children are particularly vulnerable due to their smaller size and natural reaction when scared.

‚ÄúKids tend to run‚Ä¶ That‚Äôs probably the worst thing you can do. Turn your back on a predator running, be it a lion, tiger, bear, you know you‚Äôre in trouble,‚Äù he said.

Bell said that, until the cause of James‚Äô death is confirmed, it‚Äôs too early to decide what should be done. He said rangers are working hard to manage the risks ‚Äì but for as long as humans and dingoes share the island, that risk will never truly go away.

The land‚Äôs traditional custodians, the Butchulla people, have a culturally significant bond with the island‚Äôs dingoes, stretching back thousands of years. They have long called for caps on visitor numbers, especially during the dingoes‚Äô breeding season from March to May, to lower the risk.

‚ÄúEveryone should enjoy K‚Äôgari, but they need to come when it is not the breeding season,‚Äù Christine Royan, director of the Butchulla Aboriginal Corporation, told local media.

‚ÄúThe solution is not to blame or punish the animal,‚Äù she added. ‚ÄúWe‚Äôre going to fight anybody that wants to remove the wongari from K‚ÄôGari.‚Äù

Queensland‚Äôs state premier has ruled out a cap on visitor numbers and says any formal response will come after the full results of the autopsy. Seymour has called for children to be banned from camping outside fenced areas.

‚ÄúIf the government has to tell you to keep your children within arm‚Äôs length ‚Äì that is not why people go camping. People go camping to feel free to be there within nature. I just don‚Äôt think it‚Äôs suitable for children to be camping in the unfenced areas,‚Äù he said.

Piper‚Äôs father agrees that children are at risk ‚Äì especially those who camp outside fenced areas.

‚ÄúYou cannot leave people exposed and children exposed and let parents think that it‚Äôs not going to happen to them, because we thought it wouldn‚Äôt happen to Piper.‚Äù

Over the years, individual dingoes deemed too habituated to humans have been euthanized, in consultation with the Butchulla people. It‚Äôs not a measure taken lightly and only occurs after specific dingoes pose a repeated threat to visitors‚Äô safety.

Allen, from Ecosure, says annual turnover in dingo populations is quite high ‚Äì about two thirds of the island‚Äôs dingoes die naturally each year. ‚ÄúNot every pup can survive when you‚Äôre stuck on an island,‚Äù he said.

The population typically peaks between December and February, when pups are learning to become independent. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs not uncommon for this time of year to see the larger group sizes, which coincides with summer when everybody in Australia is at the beach,‚Äù he said.

In some ways, Australia‚Äôs challenge with dingoes is not dissimilar to issues elsewhere, for example Japan‚Äôs attempts to hold bears at bay, or India‚Äôs problem with lions.

However, the dingo population is not growing ‚Äì it‚Äôs people who are becoming more common, bringing carloads of food for family trips, and driving up and down the beach where dingoes would typically hunt.

To some, they may look like small domestic dogs, but they‚Äôre unpredictable and wild. And just as tourists are urged to stay away from large predators in other nations, they need to keep their distance from dingoes, no matter how harmless they may seem.

‚ÄúIf I travel to Kruger National Park in South Africa and wanted to go for a walk, I can accept a certain level of risk. I might get eaten by a lion or stomped on by an elephant,‚Äù said Allen.

‚ÄúIf I do the same in Chitwan in Nepal, which is a beautiful national park, I‚Äôve got to put up with tigers and leopards and elephants there, too.

‚ÄúWe don‚Äôt have lions and tigers and bears, but we‚Äôve got dingoes and kangaroos and lots of venomous snakes and all that kind of thing. There‚Äôs just inherent risks with being out in nature.‚Äù

The James family plans to travel to K‚Äôgari in the coming weeks to attend a smoking ceremony as guests of the island‚Äôs traditional custodians. The ancient ritual will see smoke from smoldering native leaves waft over the island‚Äôs sandy beaches ‚Äì to cleanse, and to heal.

James wants more to change as a result of his daughter‚Äôs death ‚Äì to force a change in rules and culture, so there are more guardrails around children and young travelers, like Piper, who are strong and independent but don‚Äôt necessarily have the life experience to fully appreciate the dangers.

‚ÄúMaybe more education with Piper would help, because when you‚Äôre put on the tour, you‚Äôre educated, and then you‚Äôre protected, and then you feel safe,‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúThen you‚Äôre left alone and things are a little different than the tour.‚Äù

title: Freezing husky found under bridge dies, two people arrested
description: Erie, Pa (WJET/WFXP) ‚Äî The ANNA Shelter passed along some tragic news on Friday afternoon. The six-month-old husky puppy locked in a crate hidden under a bridge that was rescued from freezing temperatures earlier this week has crossed the Rainbow Bridge. ‚ÄúIt was heavy- I haven‚Äôt cried in a long time and I cried this [‚Ä¶]
fullText:
Erie, Pa (WJET/WFXP) ‚Äî The ANNA Shelter passed along some tragic news on Friday afternoon.

The six-month-old husky puppy locked in a crate hidden under a bridge that was rescued from freezing temperatures earlier this week has crossed the Rainbow Bridge.

Police investigating after dog found freezing under Erie bridge

‚ÄúIt was heavy- I haven‚Äôt cried in a long time and I cried this morning- like it was heavy, it was hard,‚Äù said Ruth Thompson, founder of the ANNA Shelter.

Friday morning was a heavy morning for many after news broke out that rescued dog Aimee had died.

Her story was followed by thousands of people locally and around the world, and hopes were high that her story would have a happy ending.

The vet that I talked to in Cleveland, where we sent her, he said this dog has suffered for months, and he said I‚Äôm surprised you guys got her as far along as you did,‚Äù Thompson said.

City, PennDOT crews ready for busy weekend of winter weather

After receiving reports from Erie police about aimee who was found frostbitten, emaciated and covered in her own waste, the ANNA team and their vets fought really hard to save her life.

Team ANNA said Aimee underwent an emergency surgery overnight, but didn‚Äôt make it after going into cardiac arrest. Doctors performed CPR for over 40 minutes.

The dog was found earlier this week at East Bayfront and Broad Street.

However, Erie police have arrested two people in connection with the cruelty case.

‚ÄúThey had brought it in and stated that they had found the dog. When they came in the next day, when requested, they admitted, the female admitted it was their dog and they weren‚Äôt able to take care of it but this animal needlessly suffered there are more than enough agencies that are out there that will take animals in,‚Äù said Rick Lorah, Erie chief of police.

ANNA Shelter provides update on puppy found under bridge

Criminal complaints identified the suspects as 23-year-old Scott Bayle and 26-year-old Tori Jackna.

Ruth Thompson of the ANNA Shelter said that receiving news of the arrest was bittersweet because while justice was served, a life was lost.

If you have a pet that you are struggling to take care of, erie police, and the ANNA Shelter team said that they are willing to help and surrendering a pet before it‚Äôs too late is always an option.

title: Which 2nd-year Cardinals player in line for biggest leap?
description: GLENDALE ‚Äì Despite the team‚Äôs poor record, the Arizona Cardinals 2025 draft class played extraordinary well. Many of the rookies were thrusted into position far too soon because of injuries, and in a sink or swim environment, a majority swam.
fullText:
GLENDALE ‚Äì Despite the team‚Äôs poor record, the Arizona Cardinals 2025 draft class played extraordinary well. Many of the rookies were thrusted into position far too soon because of injuries, and in a sink or swim environment, a majority swam. First-round pick Walter Nolen had one of the highest PFF grades in the NFL, while second-round pick Will Johnson was a lockdown corner for the team.

Fourth-rounder Cody Simon took on the role of green dot and did wonderfully, while the utter surprise arrival of fifth-rounder Denzel Burke was sensational. All four played a critical role of last year‚Äôs team, and as the franchise heads into 2026, which of these names will have an even bigger impact in Year 2.

With Nolen likely to miss time due to injury and Simon to have his role shrinked when Mack Wilson Sr. returns, it looks to be a two-horse race between Burke and Johnson.

Aug 9, 2025; Glendale, Arizona, USA; Arizona Cardinals cornerback Will Johnson (0) against the Kansas City Chiefs during a preseason NFL game at State Farm Stadium. Mandatory Credit: Mark J. Rebilas-Imagn Images

‚ÄúBurke‚Äôs rookie season was a roller coaster. The fifth-round pick was asked to handle a heavy workload, and despite that responsibility, he allowed just three touchdowns ‚Äî with two coming against Ja‚ÄôMarr Chase and Puka Nacua,‚Äù Pro Football Focus writer Zach Tantillo wrote. ‚ÄúHe surrendered more than 25 receiving yards to only three wide receivers all year and recorded three interceptions to lead all rookie cornerbacks.‚Äù

Aug 9, 2025; Glendale, Arizona, USA; Arizona Cardinals cornerback Denzel Burke (29) against the Kansas City Chiefs during a preseason NFL game at State Farm Stadium. Mandatory Credit: Mark J. Rebilas-Imagn Images

Burke was arguably the best rookie defensive back in the NFL last year. The former Ohio State Buckeye had three interceptions and 11 pass deflections. Regardless of the injuries, the 23-year-old played himself into a starting role towards the end of the season. Even when the roster will be healthy, Burke will be on the field.

Johnson was seen as the steal of the 2025 draft on the night. A fringe top-10 player that dropped to 47th overall to the Cardinals. The 22-year-old fell due to injury concerns, which did plague him in his rookie year. The first half of the season was rough, playing in five of the team‚Äôs first 12 games. However, he closed the season strong by playing in Arizona‚Äôs final six game.

In 12 games, Johnson had nine pass breakups, which was 12th in the NFL. He failed to record an interception in his first year, but came close many times throughout his appearances.

Nov 3, 2025; Arlington, Texas, USA; Arizona Cardinals cornerback Will Johnson (0) celebrates as he leaves the field after defeating the Dallas Cowboys at AT&T Stadium. Mandatory Credit: Jerome Miron-Imagn Images

The duo cornerbacks each showed amazing potential, but Johnson has the chance to take the biggest leap because of being sidelined by injuries for half of the year. Burke was a pleasant surprise, but one has to worry about the sophomore slump of a cornerback that overachieved. Johnson is the safer pick to have a healthier Year 2 and live up to his pre-draft comparisons.

The Cardinals secondary is filled with players like Garrett Williams and Max Melton that will get snaps. When healthy, Johnson will likely be the one getting more snaps. Burke played in 17 games but only had two games playing 100% of the defensive snaps, while Johnson had five instances.

Cardinals remain lone team interested in Raheem Morris for head coach position in 2026

title: Steelers sign veteran tight end
description: Pittsburgh adds a depth piece to their crowded tight end room.
fullText:
The Pittsburgh Steelers announced on Friday that they have signed J.J. Galbreath to a reserve/future contract. The 24-year-old tight end rejoins the Steelers after a stint with the team during training camp and on the practice squad this past season.

We have signed TE J.J. Galbreath to a Reserve/Future contract. @BordasLaw

‚Äî Pittsburgh Steelers (@steelers) January 23, 2026

Galbreath originally joined the Steelers as an undrafted free agent out of South Dakota after the 2025 Draft. The six-foot-four pass catcher shone for the Coyotes, amassing 1355 yards and 13 touchdowns during his college career. Galbreath earned first-team AP All-American honors his senior season. However, he was cut during the team‚Äôs final roster cuts in August. Galbreath briefly rejoined the team on the practice squad, but was cut after week two and has been a free agent ever since.

He appeared in three preseason games for the Steelers this past season, but only collected three catches for 23 yards during his time on the field. This reserve/future deal will now give Galbreath a better chance to impress the new coaching staff during offseason workouts and in training camp in Latrobe.

With fellow tight end Connor Heyward set to become a free agent, Galbreath will now have another shot to potentially crack the 53-man roster this season for the Steelers.

title: üòÆ Bizarre F.C.: L√∫cio Fl√°vio quits after one state league game
description: The world of football witnessed another curious episode last Thursday (22).Coach L√∫cio Fl√°vio, who had arrived at Goiatuba with hopes of reviving the team in the 2026 Campeonato Goiano, requested to...
fullText:
The world of football witnessed another curious episode last Thursday (22).

Coach L√∫cio Fl√°vio, who had arrived at Goiatuba with hopes of reviving the team in the 2026 Campeonato Goiano, requested to leave the club after leading the squad for just one round (four days of work).

The 46-year-old coach released a video announcing his departure and stating that he had accepted a new job offer ‚Äî he was announced at Uberl√¢ndia, in Minas Gerais.

A former midfielder who emerged at Paran√° in the late 1990s, L√∫cio Fl√°vio played for major clubs in Brazilian football, such as Internacional, S√£o Paulo, Coritiba, Atl√©tico-MG, Vit√≥ria, and Santos.

However, the club with which he is most closely identified is Botafogo, where he played between 2007 and 2008 and then again from 2009 to 2010.

Retired from the pitch since 2017, L√∫cio Fl√°vio began his coaching career as an assistant at Paran√° the following year.

He later served as assistant and interim coach at Botafogo between 2020 and 2023. The young coach also had stints at Aparecidense, S√£o Joseense, and Brasiliense before arriving at Goiatuba at the start of the Goian√£o.

At Goiatuba, the team‚Äôs situation in the 2026 Campeonato Goiano was already difficult before L√∫cio Fl√°vio‚Äôs arrival.

The ‚ÄúAzul√£o do Sul‚Äù started the state championship with another coach, Augusto Fassina, who was dismissed after three winless matches.

L√∫cio Fl√°vio led the team in just one match, and with only one point on the table, the club remains at the bottom of the competition. The team still has four games ahead to try to escape relegation and dream of a spot among the top eight in the state championship.

Meanwhile, Uberl√¢ndia is also going through a tough time. Before the coach‚Äôs arrival, the ‚ÄúVerd√£o‚Äù had two losses and two draws in four matches, sitting at the bottom of Group A in the Campeonato Mineiro.

In four games, the team has yet to win, suffered a 5-0 thrashing by Cruzeiro, and faces challenges ahead as they try to climb out of last place in their group in the state championship.

title: Watch live:¬†Sharon vs. Farrell boys¬†high school basketball
description: A colossal matchup is on tap for this Friday as Mercer County rivals Sharon and Farrell will clash on the hardwood for a critical District 10 showdown.
fullText:
FARRELL, Pa. (WKBN) ‚Äì A colossal matchup is on tap for this Friday as Mercer County rivals Sharon and Farrell will clash on the hardwood for a critical District 10 showdown.

It‚Äôll be a historic night at E.J. McCluskey Gymnasium.

Jan. 24, 2025 ‚Äì Sharon, 70-60
Feb. 6, 2018 ‚Äì Sharon, 57-46
Jan. 13, 2018 ‚Äì Sharon, 70-45
Feb. 7, 2017 ‚Äì Sharon, 63-53

Recent Meeting
Farrell featured five double-figure scorers as the Steelers were led by Juelz Johnson‚Äôs triple-double (24 points, 10 rebounds and 12 assists). Levi Hailstock and Derek Douglas added 19 and 16 for the Tigers.

Team Statistics
Scoring Offense: Sharon, 58.9; Farrell, 52.6
Scoring Defense: Sharon, 50.4; Farrell, 53.3

Game Notes
-Sharon had defeated Farrell in four straight meetings before falling last year on Feb. 11, 71-67, to the Steelers.

-The Tigers defeated Central Valley, 60-55, at Westminster College on Sunday behind a trio of double-digit scorers: Cedrick Boyd (18), Jeremiah Nixon (18) and Heath Miller (16). Three days later (on Wednesday), Sharon won a thriller in overtime, 61-59, by topping Hickory. Nixon led the way with 22.

-Sharon‚Äôs won eight of nine games where they‚Äôve held the opposition to 55 points or less this year.

Marvin Redding leads Sharon past rival Farrell

-Since the Steelers‚Äô 10-point win against Harding on Jan. 3 (51-41), Farrell had dropped four games in a row before posting a 71-56 victory over Mercer on Wednesday. Three of those four setbacks were decided by 6 points or less (Neighborhood Academy by 6, Hickory by 3 on a last-second buzzer beater, Moon by 3).

description: A must win match.
fullText:

‚ÄúSemenyo couldn‚Äôt play there in Bodo [which didn‚Äôt help].

title: ‚ÄòSkyscraper Live‚Äô: Where to Watch, Who‚Äôs Climbing and What Happens If He Falls
description: Here's everything you need to know about the adrenaline trip that will be "Skyscraper Live" on Netflix
fullText:
Calling all adrenaline junkies, Netflix has a broadcast specifically for you this week. Well, it‚Äôs specifically for adrenaline junkies who are probably not also stressed out by heights.

On Friday, professional climber Alex Honnold will be scaling his next mountain ‚Äî except it‚Äôs not a mountain. Instead, he‚Äôll be free-climbing a literal skyscraper, and yes, free-climbing means exactly what you think it does. He‚Äôll have no ropes or harnesses attached, no safety nets to land in, he‚Äôs just‚Ä¶climbing a building.

The climb will begin at 5 p.m. PT/8 p.m. ET on Netflix, on Friday, Jan. 23. It will be streamed live, so you can see the whole thing.

Alex Hannold is a professional rock climber, who you might recognize from the documentary ‚ÄúFree Solo.‚Äù He‚Äôs a veteran at climbing.

Hannold will be scaling Taipei 101, one of the tallest buildings in the world. As you likely guessed from its name, the building is in Taiwan.

In total, Taipei 101 has, well, 101 stories. It‚Äôs 1,667 feet tall.

In Hannold‚Äôs own words: ‚ÄúWhy not?‚Äù According to the climber, the building is ‚Äúpossible, which a lot of skyscrapers aren‚Äôt ‚Äî it‚Äôs uniquely suited for climbing.‚Äù

It appears not. Hannold will truly solo climb and he admitted to Tudum himself that ‚ÄúMy life is on the line.‚Äù

According to Hannold himself, if something goes wrong, he‚Äôll probably die, as he explained to CNN during a recent sit-down interview. However, as he noted, with this particular building, there are a lot of balconies spread out accross a long stretch of the climb ‚ÄúThe geometry of the building, the shape of the building is such that you actually could fall in tons of places and not actually die,‚Äù Hannold described, ‚Äúwhich makes it in some ways safer than a lot of rock-climbing objectives.‚Äù

In the same interview, Hannold described it as a low-risk, high-consequence activity ‚Äî meaning that, most likely, he‚Äôll incur no injury at all, but if something goes wrong, the stakes are extremely high. In contrast, he describes sports football as high-risk, lower-consequence, since athletes regularly have career-ending, but not life-ending, accidents on the field.

Producers have also clarified that there will be a 10-second delay, and if the worst should happen, they will cut away.

The post ‚ÄòSkyscraper Live‚Äô: Where to Watch, Who‚Äôs Climbing and What Happens If He Falls appeared first on TheWrap.

title: Falcons listed as best landing spot for Super Bowl-winning quarterback
description: Atlanta could look to retool its quarterback depth.
fullText:
Falcons listed as best landing spot for Super Bowl-winning quarterback originally appeared on The Sporting News. Add The Sporting News as a Preferred Source by clicking here.

The quarterback position in Atlanta is a bit up in the air right now. Michael Penix is the team‚Äôs QB of the future, but he might not be ready for the start of the 2026 season after suffering a torn ACL in November.

The Falcons also have veteran Kirk Cousins on the roster, but they could look to release him in a cost-cutting move in the coming weeks.

If they do move on from Cousins, they would need to identify another quarterback who could potentially serve as a starter in Penix‚Äôs absence and then shift to a reserve role. That‚Äôs where Joe Flacco could come in.

In a recent article, Kristopher Knox of Bleacher Report¬†listed the Falcons as the best landing spot for Flacco, citing his relationship with new head coach Kevin Stefanski and ability to effectively operate as a fill-in starter.

‚ÄúIf the Falcons don't retain Cousins as veteran insurance, Flacco would be the perfect alternative. Stefanski and Flacco helped take the Browns to the playoffs in 2023, and the pair could likely get Atlanta off to a hot start if Penix isn't ready to go when the season opens,‚Äù Knox wrote.

‚ÄúThe Falcons don't quite have the receiving corps that the Bengals have, but Flacco would probably find success alongside Drake London, Bijan Robinson, and Kyle Pitts‚Äîassuming Pitts is retained in free agency.‚Äù

Flacco would certainly be cheaper than Cousins, and even thought he‚Äôs 41 years old, he‚Äôs demonstrated that he can still run an offense at a high level.

In 13 games ‚Äì and 10 starts ‚Äì split between Cleveland and Cincinnati last season, Flacco threw for 2,479 yards and 13 touchdowns, compared to just four interceptions.

First, the Falcons have to figure out what they want to do with Cousins. If they do decide to move on from him, Flacco could actually make a lot of sense as a replacement.

title: Trinity Rodman could have left the NWSL. The Spirit community made it impossible to leave
description: Trinity Rodman has been called a generational talent. Not necessarily because she is the best in the world ‚Äî three-time Ballon d‚ÄôOr winner Aitana Bonmati is still at the top of that list ‚Äî but because of what she offers as a whole. From her signature, defense-splitting ‚ÄúTrin Spin‚Äù move on the field to her entertaining and profitable presence off it, keeping Rodman in the National Women‚Äôs Soccer League was so crucial to the current trajectory of women‚Äôs soccer in America that the league changed i
fullText:
Trinity Rodman has been called a generational talent. Not necessarily because she is the best in the world ‚Äî three-time Ballon d‚ÄôOr winner Aitana Bonmati is still at the top of that list ‚Äî but because of what she offers as a whole.

From her signature, defense-splitting ‚ÄúTrin Spin‚Äù move on the field to her entertaining and profitable presence off it, keeping Rodman in the National Women‚Äôs Soccer League was so crucial to the current trajectory of women‚Äôs soccer in America that the league changed its rules to ensure it happened.

The reality is that Rodman could have walked away. The 23-year-old‚Äôs previous contract with the Washington Spirit ended on Dec. 31. She had options from Europe, including from Chelsea, which has been willing to splash some cash on U.S. players. But she stuck it out with her team and her city, even after a¬†previous agreement vetoed by the league sparked arguments about the NWSL‚Äôs salary-cap rules.

Rodman was rewarded for that loyalty with one of the biggest salaries in women‚Äôs soccer history. She will take home more than $2 million a year for the next three years, benefitting from a change in league rules to allow such spending.

‚ÄúGetting drafted here and developing and maturing and learning and failing at Spirit and in D.C., it‚Äôs become so much of my legacy and my story. But on top of that, I still feel like there‚Äôs so much more I have to give and so much more that I want to do,‚Äù Rodman said during her contract signing ceremony on Thursday.

Many will claim credit for finally ending the mind-boggling saga around keeping the superstar in the league, but the rich soccer community in Washington, D.C., should not go overlooked. Thursday was a welcome reminder of the anomaly that is women‚Äôs soccer, where the love of the game can still sometimes outweigh balance sheets.

Owner Michele Kang‚Äôs willingness to pay a player what she‚Äôs worth and Rodman‚Äôs persistence in demanding nothing less were only successful when paired with the growing relationship between the team and its fans.

To understand how that connection became so strong ‚Äî and how it might be emulated elsewhere ‚Äî you have to go back to the beginning.

The Spirit selected Rodman No. 2 in the 2021 draft. At the time, Kang, who now owns professional women‚Äôs teams on three continents, was only a minority investor. While there was plenty of excitement around the young prospect, whose surname was already synonymous with championships in another sport thanks to her father, soccer took a backseat to off-field issues months ahead of the postseason.

In September 2021, the Spirit fired head coach Richie Burke following allegations of emotional and verbal harassment. Shortly after, the Spirit had to forfeit two games for violating the league‚Äôs COVID-19 policy. Majority owner Steve Baldwin, who was accused of allowing Burke to quietly step away rather than force a more public vetting of the allegations surrounding his coach, battled with Kang for control of the team.¬†Kang called for Baldwin to step down and sell his shares to her.

Without protection from the front office, the drama seeped into the players‚Äô day-to-day work, and they eventually called for Baldwin to sell his stake in the team to Kang. Following the COVID forfeits, the team lost just twice in the last 13 games and won the club‚Äôs first NWSL Championship. Rodman, for her part, won rookie of the year.

Baldwin eventually agreed to sell for $35 million, more than seven times the team‚Äôs valuation at the time. However, it wasn‚Äôt until March 30, 2022, that Kang was finally able to gain control of the club.

Leaders such as midfielder Andi Sullivan and goalkeeper Aubrey Kingsbury, who consistently fielded questions about the off-field obstacles, are still key parts of the team‚Äôs leadership in 2026. That matters. The fans who stuck by the players matter, too.

The Spirit‚Äôs home, Audi Field, has earned the name ‚ÄúRowdy Audi‚Äù after three seasons of record attendance, which reached an average of 10,866 in 2023, 13,940 in 2024 and 15,110 in 2025. With sellouts becoming commonplace, it‚Äôs easy to forget that before 2023, the Spirit spent many home games at small venues more than an hour outside the city, sometimes with less than 10,000-seat capacity.

‚ÄúThe fan base, the stadium, you can‚Äôt (compare) ‚Äî even other NWSL teams (don‚Äôt) get these amount of fans,‚Äù Rodman said. ‚ÄúI feel it, and you see it with all the interactions I have. I wouldn‚Äôt trade it for the world.‚Äù

In 2021, the players rallied around each other, and the fans rallied around the players. In 2025, that support has grown by the thousands. Rodman is without a doubt part of that growth, and she bears that responsibility openly.

After the Spirit defeated Racing Louisville in the 2025 NWSL quarterfinals, Rodman sprinted to the wall of supporters to celebrate. It had been her first game back since a minor MCL sprain kept her out of the previous playoff match and regular-season finale. Likely to the dismay of a nearby athletic trainer, Rodman hopped into the stands alongside teammate Esme Morgan and waved the supporters‚Äô massive flag to erupting cheers. She made a similar show of respect after the team‚Äôs semifinal win over the Portland Thorns, their final home game of the season. The win helped Washington reach its second final in as many years.

That moment illustrated the importance of the community the Spirit have created.

Five years ago, Alex Morgan and Megan Rapinoe were the names synonymous with soccer in America and women‚Äôs soccer as a whole. Now, Rodman has taken that crown, even if she spent much of last year sidelined by injuries. In all, she played 17 games and scored five goals. Yet when she came on the field in the NWSL Championship, PayPal Park in San Jose, Calif. reached its loudest decibel level of the night.

The 23-year-old Olympic gold medalist has endured seven club coaches, multiple home venues and new ownership. Throughout it all, she‚Äôs helped build a soccer power.

Kang and other team executives made clear last Thursday how much those fans matter. They brought up an elementary school student and Spirit supporter named Emma to deliver Rodman‚Äôs new contract. Rodman embraced Emma ‚Äî and her pink box braids that mirrored Rodman‚Äôs iconic look from the 2024 Olympics ‚Äî and talked about how she wants to use her extended time with the Spirit to give back to the youth in D.C.

Cynically, it could be seen as a marketing move to sell more tickets. With private equity and skyrocketing valuations becoming a bigger part of the women‚Äôs game, not every gesture can be taken at face value. Kang, who owns London City Lioness in England and OL Lyonnes in France, is among the owners whose motives have been questioned. Women‚Äôs soccer has gone overlooked and mistreated for so long that scar tissue remains.

However, Thursday showed what happens when the community aspect of women‚Äôs soccer is not just embraced, but invested in.

‚ÄúI can‚Äôt think about the Washington Spirit without her,‚Äù Kang said. ‚ÄúI hope she can‚Äôt think about her career without Washington Spirit.‚Äù

Rodman could have walked away. Instead, she made it abundantly clear that she wanted to stay, for the team, the fans and herself.

This article originally appeared in The Athletic.

US Women's national team, Washington Spirit, NWSL, Women's Soccer

2026 The Athletic Media Company

title: Blades Brown, 18, shoots historic round in PGA Tour's American Express
description: Brown's round, which included one eagle and 10 birdies, tied the course record but his putt for a coveted 59 went right of the hole.
fullText:
LA QUINTA, CA ‚Äî All the talk of playing in the Bahamas and private flights across the country and late-night fast-food runs faded under the brilliance of a Southern California day and the talent of Blades Brown on Friday, Jan. 23.

Brown, who made his professional debut at 17 years old last year at The American Express, fired a 12-under 60 on the Nicklaus Tournament Course at PGA West in the second round of the PGA Tour event at the La Quinta Country Club. It was the lowest round in the PGA Tour by an 18-year-old since 1983.

Brown, seeking an historic 59, parred the final three holes including a 7-foot putt on his final hole that rolled agonizingly wide right.

"I saw my spot just a little before the hole. I got a great read off David Ford," Brown said of his final putt for 59. "He dripped it in there and it went right dead center. So I was thinking, okay, maybe just a little outside right edge. Unfortunately, it didn't break, but it's all right. I'm not worried about it."

As he watched his putt sail right, Brown looked to the heavens in disappointment as a large gallery groaned, obviously aware of the moment and wanting to be a part of history. But the smile returned to his face moments later after tapping in his par, for a course record and stamping himself as a rising star in the sport.

LEADERBOARD: Full results from The American Express

"I just really like this golf course. There's something about the Nicklaus Course that I just really like," said Brown, who shot 64 on the course in 2025 including a run of six consecutive birdies. "Like, it's so money. It's so pure. Everything is just perfectly well-kempt. I love playing with no wind. So when you put all those things together it's fun."

He was bidding for the 16th sub-60 round in PGA Tour history and the third ever shot at the desert's PGA event.

Brown, a member of the Korn Ferry Tour and in the field this week on a sponsor's exemption, shares the 36-hole lead in the tournament at 17-under, with world No. 1 Scottie Scheffler. Scheffler, playing four groups ahead of Brown, fired a 64 on the Nicklaus course. Si Woo Kim fired a 65 on the Pete Dye Stadium Course, the toughest of the three courses in the rotation, and is alone in third at 16 under.

Brown wasn't the only player to make it to the 18th hole with a shot at a 59 on Friday. Andrew Putnam, playing at La Quinta Country Club, had a 30-foot birdie putt on the 18th hole, but missed and had to settle for a fantastic 12-under 60 to tie the course record.

Brown began his day on the 10th hole at the Nicklaus course and birdied the first hole, followed by an eagle on the par-5 11th. Brown then made five consecutive birdies to reach 8 under through seven holes before making three consecutive pars.

But starting on the second hole on the front nine (his back), Brown regained his torrid scoring touch, with four birdies in his next five holes to get to 12 under for the day. He managed just a par on the par-5 seventh hole, then missed makeable birdie putts on the eighth and ninth hole which would've given him a magical 59.

Brown or Putnam would've been the third golfer shoot 59 at The American Express. David Duval shot the number in the final round of the 1999 tournament on the Palmer Course at PGA West to win the tournament. Adam Hadwin shot 59 in the third round of the 2017 event at La Quinta Country Club, but Hadwin ended up second that week behind Hudson Swafford.

Brown's fantastic round comes just two days after he finish play in the Korn Ferry Tour event in the Bahamas, where Brown finished tied for 17th. Brown took a private jet for six hours to get to the Southern California desert late Wednesday night, hit fast-foot restaurant Panda Express, went to a grocery store and then went to sleep before his 9:58 a.m. tee time Thursday. Brown shot 5-under 67 at La Quinta Country Club to open the event.

Putnam's round at La Quinta Country Clubs starter slower than Brown's with just one birdie in his first three holes. But Putnam, 36 and with one PGA Tour victory, rattled off six consecutive birdies and capped that run with an eagle on the par-5 11th to get to 9-under for the day. He added two birdies at 13 and 14 and another at 17 to reach 12 under before making the long two-putt for a par on the 18th hole.

The 60 moved Putnam to 12 under for the tournament, tied for 18th in a week where low scoring seems to be at a record pace. The two 60s even overshadowed Scheffler, the No. 1 player in the world who cruised to a 64 for his second consecutive bogey-free round in his first tournament of the year. One of the players to have shot 59 in an event back in 2020, Scheffler said he wouldn't have been too surprised had the day produced two 59s.

"The courses are in good shape, you've got good weather conditions, I think that's a recipe for some low scores when you got guys with the amount of talent that we have out here on tour," Scheffler said. "I think when you get those two things together you're going to see some low scores."

Both Scheffler and Brown will move to the Stadium Course for the third round Saturday. Brown was in contention to make the cut in the 2025 American Express but a third-round 74 on the Stadium Course moved him outside of the cut line in his pro debut.

"(Saturday) obviously the Stadium Course is the more difficult of the three golf courses," Brown said. "I haven't played it yet (this year), so I'm just going to go see where I can hit it down the fairway, hit it on the green, and try to make a putt."

The idea of a Sunday final group including Scheffler and Brown is tantalizing. Scheffler says he only knows a little bit of Brown's story and does not know Brown personally.

"These kids coming out, they know they got to come out and make some birdies. I think when you're coming out young you don't have as much scar tissue as the guys that are a little bit more seasoned, and you just come out, and if you want to make a name for yourself you got to put up some good scores," Scheffler said. "It sounds like an 18-year-old shooting 59 is a pretty good start to his career there."

Brown said he'd love the chance to play with the world's No. 1.

"I think that would be awesome, yeah. Scottie is an unbelievable golfer," Brown said. "I'd try to learn from him as much as I can the way he plays the golf course. There's a lot of strategy in his game, and he's obviously an unbelievable ball-striker. So it's really cool watching him play some golf."

Jake Knapp (59): 2025 Cognizant Classic (Round 1)

Hayden Springs (59): 2024 John Deere Classic (Round 1)

Cameron Young (59): 2024 Travelers Championship (Round 3)

Scottie Scheffler (59): 2020 The Northern Trust (Round 2)

Kevin Chappell (59): 2019 Military Tribute at the Greenbrier (Round 2)

Brandt Snedeker (59): 2018 Wyndam Championship (Round 1)

Adam Hadwin (59): 2017 Career Builder Challenge (Round 3)

Justin Thomas (59): 2017 Sony Open (Round 1)

Jim Furyk (58): 2016 Travelers Championship (Round 2)

Jim Furyk (59): 2013 BMW Championship (Round 2)

Stuart Appleby (59): 2010 Greenbrier Classic (Round 4)

Paul Goydos (59): 2010 John Deere Classic (Round 1)

David Duval (59): 1999 Bob Hope Chrysler Classic (Round 4)

Chip Beck (59): 1991 Las Vegas Invitational (Round 3)

Al Geiberger (59): 1977 Memphis Classic (Round 2)

title: Teen Blades Brown shoots 60 to share PGA La Quinta lead with Scheffler
description:
Teenager Blades Brown fired a spectacular 12-under par 60 to join world number one Scottie Scheffler atop the leaderboard after two rounds of the PGA Tour American Express in La Quinta, California, on Friday.American Andrew Putnam also flirted with a 59 before settling for a 12-under 60 on the La Quinta course that left him 12-under for the tournament.
bb/amz
fullText:
Teenager Blades Brown fired a spectacular 12-under par 60 to join world number one Scottie Scheffler atop the leaderboard after two rounds of the PGA Tour American Express in La Quinta, California, on Friday.

The 18-year-old from Tennessee just missed out on a 59 when his birdie putt at his final hole slipped by on the right side.

"I'm so stoked to have shot 60 on the PGA Tour," Brown said, acknowledging that nerves "absolutely" kicked in over the final three holes.

He had made a dazzling start on the Nicklaus Tournament course, one of three in use over the first three rounds of the event.

Brown, who made his pro debut at La Quinta last year, teed off on 10 and was eight under through his first seven holes thanks to an eagle and six birdies.

After a birdie at the second he strung together three more at the fourth, fifth and sixth to reach 12-under for the day.

He couldn't capitalize on the par-five seventh, settling for a par after his second shot found the rough.

After a par at the eighth he had one more chance at the 16th sub-60 round ever on the PGA Tour at the par-four ninth, where a mammoth drive and a crisp wedge left him a birdie look from inside seven feet that he couldn't convert.

"I saw my spot just a little before the hole," he said. "I got a great read off David Ford. He dripped it in there and it went right dead center. So I was thinking, OK, maybe just a little outside right edge.

"Unfortunately it didn't go in, but I'm really happy with the outcome I had today."

It was the continuation of a whirlwind week for Brown, who finished tied for 17th in the Korn Ferry developmental tour event in the Bahamas on Wednesday, then, with a sponsor's exemption to play in La Quinta, made his way to California in time to tee it up on Thursday.

He goes into the weekend tied on 17-under 127 with Scheffler, who had eight birdies in his eight-under 64 on the Nicklaus Tournament course.

Scheffler is making his season debut after a 2025 campaign that included two major titles among his six wins.

Thrilled to have his name next to Scheffler's atop the leaderboard, Brown wasn't getting ahead of himself.

"We're halfway there. We've got a lot of golf to go," he said, adding that his next order of business would be getting some rest.

"I'm going to go take a nap," Brown said.

The leading duo were one stroke clear of South Korean Kim Si-Woo, who posted a 65 on the tougher Stadium Course for a 16-under total of 128.

It was a further stroke back to South Korea's Kim Seong-hyeon and American Matt McCarty.

American Andrew Putnam also flirted with a 59 before settling for a 12-under 60 on the La Quinta course that left him 12-under for the tournament.

title: 'Heated Rivalry's Harrison Browne says new anti-trans hockey policy is 'crazy' and blames Trump
description: ‚ÄúWhat hormones people have in their bodies play a very small part in what they are able to do athletically," the Heated Rivalry star told PRIDE.
fullText:
It turns out trans student athletes aren‚Äôt the only ones who are having to contend with politicians keeping them from playing sports, now adult trans hockey players are facing challenges too.

Harrison Browne, who starred in Heated Rivalry and was the first openly transgender pro hockey player, is speaking out against USA Hockey‚Äôs new eligibility policy, which doesn‚Äôt outright ban trans athletes, but makes it almost impossible for them to compete even in recreational leagues.

Back in November, USA Hockey, the national governing body for hockey, which oversees the U.S. participation in the Olympics, quietly released a new Participant Eligibility Policy, but when Browne found out about it yesterday, he immediately took to Instagram to alert his followers to the updated anti-trans rules.

‚ÄúUSA Hockey is basically telling me I can‚Äôt play in a recreational league with friends that I played my entire career with,‚Äù Browne told PRIDE. ‚ÄúI just think that‚Äôs crazy."

The new policy, which updates what previously was a much more inclusive version from 2019, will put strict rules on who can play in youth, junior, disabled, and adult hockey leagues when it goes into effect on April 1, 2026. According to the updated policy, trans athletes can still play in co-ed leagues, but they are restricted to their sex assigned at birth when it comes to sex-exclusive leagues.

‚ÄúIn all programs where participation is restricted by sex, athletes are only permitted to participate in such programs based on their sex assigned at birth, except that a female (as assigned at birth) may not play in programs restricted to females if they have undergone any male hormone therapy,‚Äù the policy reads.

This means that trans women would be forced to play in men‚Äôs leagues, and trans men would have to play in women‚Äôs leagues unless they take testosterone, in which case they wouldn‚Äôt be allowed in either space.

‚ÄúThe safest spaces I‚Äôve found are queer spaces, are women‚Äôs spaces,‚Äù Browne said, explaining that forcing trans women to play in men‚Äôs leagues wouldn‚Äôt be safe because they are still plagued by ‚Äúhomophobia and transphobic language, whether that‚Äôs on the ice or behind closed doors in the locker room.‚Äù

While not an outright ban, this new policy will make it nearly impossible for trans hockey players to play in any league overseen by USA Hockey, which includes less competitive recreational leagues, often called ‚Äúbeer leagues‚Äù by players.

Women‚Äôs hockey leagues across the country are having to deal with the new policy, with some taking to social media to assure players that they are looking into what it will mean for them. The Seattle Women‚Äôs Hockey Club wrote on Instagram, ‚ÄúTo our trans members: it is the board's firm belief that our community is better for having you in it. Hockey belongs to anyone who has ever picked up a stick or cheered on their team, and that includes you, regardless of what USA Hockey says.‚Äù

Browne places the blame for this shift from a fairly inclusive trans participation policy to one that, in practice, will likely keep many trans athletes from playing hockey squarely on President Donald Trump‚Äôs shoulders. ‚ÄúWe can‚Äôt overlook the fact that the [Trump] Administration is putting a lot of pressure on sports organizations to make a stance against trans participation in sports,‚Äù he said.

Republicans frequently claim that their focus on trans women in sports is because they care about fairness, but the argument is specious and ignores the larger issues in the sport, Browne said.

‚ÄúTransgender women, transgender people are not the issue here,‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúIt is socioeconomic status, it‚Äôs access. If you have access to better coaching, if you have access to better facilities, better equipment, better nutrition, you are automatically going to be a better athlete. What hormones people have in their bodies play a very small part in what they are able to do athletically.‚Äù

This article originally appeared on Pride: 'Heated Rivalry's Harrison Browne says new anti-trans hockey policy is 'crazy' and blames Trump

title: Ryan Wedding, Olympic athlete turned alleged drug kingpin, arrested
description: Ryan Wedding, a 44-year-old Canadian national, was added to the FBI's Ten Most Wanted Fugitives list last year.
fullText:
Former Olympic snowboarder Ryan Wedding, an alleged drug kingpin who's been accused of orchestrating multiple murders, was arrested in Mexico and taken to the United States, Justice Department officials announced Friday.

Wedding, a 44-year-old Canadian national, was taken into custody in Mexico City on Thursday night, FBI Director Kash Patel said at a news conference at Southern California's Ontario International Airport east of Los Angeles. During the news conference, Patel gestured to a plane behind him and told reporters Wedding had been taken off the plane.

An FBI official in Los Angeles told CBS News the U.S. government plane carrying Wedding landed at the airport from Mexico at approximately 8 a.m. local time Friday.

In a video clip provided by the FBI, a handcuffed Wedding is seen wearing jeans, sneakers, a sweatshirt, a vest and a baseball cap walking down a stairway from the plane flanked by FBI agents. Another clip shows Wedding and authorities walking away from the plane.

"Just to tell you how bad of a guy Ryan Wedding is, he went from an Olympic snowboarder to the largest narco-trafficker in modern times," Patel said. "He is a modern-day 'El Chapo,' he is a modern-day Pablo Escobar, and he thought he could evade justice."

"El Chapo" is an alias for Joaquin Guzman, a onetime leader of the notorious Mexican drug ring known as the Sinaloa Cartel who is serving a life sentence in the U.S. According to the FBI, Wedding also used aliases, including "El Jefe," "Giant" and "Public Enemy."

Patel also said another fugitive who was arrested in Mexico last week,¬†Alejandro Rosales Castillo, was brought to the U.S. on the same plane as Wedding and would be taken east later Friday. Patel said Castillo's arrest wasn't related to Wedding's apprehension.

Patel told reporters he was in Mexico on a previously planned trip. He said the Mexican government worked with the U.S. to apprehend Wedding.

"This was a great operation that came together through interagency success," Patel said.

Patel said he wouldn't provide additional details about Wedding's arrest "to safeguard the integrity of the ongoing investigation." He declined to comment on the $15 million reward that was being offered by the U.S. for Wedding.

When officials increased the reward in November, U.S. Attorney General Pam Bondi described Wedding's alleged operation as "one of the most prolific and violent drug-trafficking organizations in this world."

The Justice Department said it expects Wedding's arraignment to take place on Monday afternoon in Los Angeles.

Akil Davis, the assistant director in charge of the FBI's Los Angeles field office, said investigators worked for over a year to arrest Wedding. "Ryan Wedding tormented several people and several families that will never be the same, but today, they get the justice that they sought," Davis said.

Wedding, who competed in the 2002 Winter Olympics in Salt Lake City, has been accused of running a major drug trafficking network that moved cocaine from Colombia through Mexico to the U.S. and Canada. Patel said in a social media post¬†Friday that Wedding was running his alleged operation as a member of the¬†Sinaloa Cartel, and that Wedding was believed to have been hiding out in Mexico for over a decade.

Wedding was added to the FBI's Ten Most Wanted Fugitives list last year.

In November, Wedding was accused of placing a "multimillion-dollar bounty" on a federal witness who was involved in a narcotics case against him.

According to the FBI, Wedding and his second-in-command Andrew Clark, 34, allegedly also ordered the killings of two members of a Canadian family in 2023 in retaliation for a stolen drug shipment.

Clark was extradited to the U.S. from Mexico last year.

The pair are also accused of directing the killing of another person in 2024 over a drug debt, according to the FBI.

title: Latest on Aaron Glenn's Jets coaching staff: NY moving on from several assistants
description: Aaron Glenn is searching for a new defensive coordinator for his second season with the Jets. Here's the latest on that search...
fullText:
Aaron Glenn is searching for a new defensive coordinator for his second season with the Jets. Here's the latest on that search...

The Jets are moving on from a number of coaches, including QB coach Charles London, DL coach Eric Washington, LB coach Aaron Curry and pass game coordinator Scott Turner.

SNY's Connor Hughes said on the latest episode of Jets Final Drive that players had "a lot" of issues with Washington and Curry, but Turner being relieved comes as a surprise.

With the mid-season release of DC Steve Wilks, Jets coach Aaron Glenn has now relieved five coaches of their duties.

The Jets were busy in the second week of their offseason, completing a first round of interviews for eight candidates for the vacant DC job.

The team announced that they completed virtual interviews with Wink Martindale, Jim Leonhard, Chris Harris, Jim O'Neil, DeMarcus Covington, Daronte Jones, Mathieu Araujo, and Ephraim Banda.

Martindale is the most senior of the group at 65 years old and has the most experience as a defensive coordinator at the NFL level. Recently, the DC at Michigan, he worked last in the NFL with the Giants, where he had a rocky relationship with then-head coach Brian Daboll. Martindale also held the DC job for four seasons in Baltimore and one in Denver.

Leonhard started 40 games over three seasons as a safety for the Jets. After finishing a 10-year playing career, he entered coaching, spending several years at his alma mater, Wisconsin. He was the DC with the Badgers from 2017-22, finishing as the interim head coach for the last seven games. He made the jump to the NFL in 2024 with another of his former teams, the Broncos, where he's been a defensive backs coach and pass game coordinator for the past two seasons, adding assistant head coach to his title this year.

Harris was hired to Glenn's staff last offseason to be the defensive back coach and passing game coordinator, but finished as interim DC after Steve Wilks' firing. Before coming to New York, the eight-year NFL veteran was Washington's defensive backs coach (2020-22) and Tennessee's DBs coach and passing game coordinator (2023-24).

O'Neil has experience with Glenn in Detroit, where he's worked as a defensive assistant since 2024. He got his first NFL gig with the Jets in 2009 as a defensive quality control coach before serving as assistant DBs coach from 2010-12. He was Cleveland's defensive coordinator for two seasons (2014-15), along with NFL stops in Buffalo (2013), San Francisco (2016), Oakland/Las Vegas (2019-20).

Covington also has experience working as a DC in the NFL, holding that position with New England during the 2024 season. He first joined the Patriots under Bill Belichick, serving as a coaching assistant, outside linebackers coach, and defensive line coach after joining in 2016. He served as defensive line coach/run game coordinator with Green Bay in 2025.

Jones was the passing game coordinator and defensive backs coach with the Vikings. He first came to Minnesota in 2020, leaving for one season to be LSU's defensive coordinator in 2021.

Araujo spent the past four seasons, his first in the pro ranks as a coach, with Miami coaching defensive backs.

Banda has been the Browns' safeties coach since 2023 after spending several years coaching in college, including a stint as the DC at Utah State (2021-22).

title: Inter Milan Head Coach Delighted With Italy Starlet‚Äôs Attitude & Accepts Blame For Sommer Mistake In 6-2 Pisa Rout: ‚ÄòIt‚Äôs My Fault‚Äô
description: Cristian Chivu experienced a night of mixed emotions at San Siro, but one that ultimately ended in celebration as Inter Milan stormed back to beat Pisa 6-2 and strengthen their grip on top spot.Speaki...
fullText:
Cristian Chivu experienced a night of mixed emotions at San Siro, but one that ultimately ended in celebration as Inter Milan stormed back to beat Pisa 6-2 and strengthen their grip on top spot.

Speaking to DAZN after the match, the Inter head coach reflected on a chaotic evening, took responsibility for key moments, and praised the mentality of his squad, particularly young striker Francesco Pio Esposito.

Asked about Federico Dimarco‚Äôs introduction and the dramatic shift in momentum, Chivu stressed that belief never dropped.

‚ÄúI didn‚Äôt think anything special,‚Äù he explained, with quotes via FCInterNews.

‚ÄúA match lasts 100 minutes and you can turn it around. You have to keep doing certain things. The approach wasn‚Äôt bad, then we scored against ourselves, but that‚Äôs my fault because I make specific demands of the goalkeeper role that put Yann in difficulty. The goal is my fault, not his.‚Äù

MILAN, ITALY ‚Äì DECEMBER 06: Cristian Chivu, Head Coach of FC Internazionale Milano, looks on prior to the Serie A match between FC Internazionale and Como 1907 at Giuseppe Meazza Stadium on December 06, 2025 in Milan, Italy. (Photo by Marco Luzzani/Getty Images)

Chivu also addressed Pisa‚Äôs second goal, pointing to their physical qualities.

‚ÄúThen the second goal came. Pisa have players with structure and they delivered the corner well,‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúAfter that, we brought out our pride, pushed the intensity, and turned it around before half-time.‚Äù

The Inter coach then focused on the collective response, especially from players introduced from the bench.

‚ÄúWhat matters is attitude and mental preparation,‚Äù Chivu said.

‚ÄúYou know you can suffer at times. You have to be responsible for how you behave and how you react. Today we did that well despite the difficulties. We could have suffered mentally, but the team kept doing what it knows how to do.‚Äù

He also highlighted the effort shown across the group.

‚ÄúMaybe there‚Äôs some regret about conceding the 4-2 late on, but hats off to these lads. They give everything they have to make this season competitive and reach our objectives.‚Äù

MILAN, ITALY ‚Äì JANUARY 14: Francesco Pio Esposito of FC Internazionale Milano celebrates scoring his team‚Äôs first goal with his Head Coach, Cristian Chivu, during the Serie A match between FC Internazionale and US Lecce at Giuseppe Meazza Stadium on January 14, 2026 in Milan, Italy. (Photo by Marco Luzzani/Getty Images)

Chivu even found room for humour when asked about his back pain after the decisive fourth goal.

‚ÄúI filled myself with cortisone,‚Äù he joked. ‚ÄúTomorrow I have to spend the day with my children and my wife. They want me fresh so I can be a good husband and a good father.‚Äù

Much of the post-match focus centred on Pio Esposito, whose performances continue to grow. Chivu made it clear where the credit lies.

‚ÄúThe credit is theirs, in how they work and make themselves available to the group,‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúThey know that every mistake they make is my fault, while they are the protagonists when things go well because they try to meet my demands.‚Äù

He praised Esposito‚Äôs mindset in particular.

‚ÄúIt‚Äôs the merit of a boy who wants to prove himself, who wants to put himself on the line and take responsibility like everyone else. If things don‚Äôt go well, it‚Äôs my fault. But I like that they follow me and want to make this season what we all hope it can be.‚Äù

MILAN, ITALY ‚Äì NOVEMBER 09: Cristian Chivu, Head Coach of Internazionale, looks on prior to the Serie A match between FC Internazionale and SS Lazio at Giuseppe Meazza Stadium on November 09, 2025 in Milan, Italy. (Photo by Marco Luzzani/Getty Images)

Chivu also brushed aside questions about watching rival fixtures.

‚ÄúThis question again‚Ä¶‚Äù he smiled. ‚ÄúI have a passion for football that goes beyond what people think. I watch a lot of matches, but tomorrow the priority is family. Recently I‚Äôve been absent because I think too much about these wonderful lads and forget my duty as a good husband and father. Sometimes you can‚Äôt think only about football.‚Äù

Speaking separately to Inter TV, Chivu returned to the themes of maturity and growth.

‚ÄúWe approached the match in the right way, then the opponents came into it and we made some mistakes,‚Äù he said, with quotes again courtesy of FCInterNews.

‚ÄúWe did well to stay clear-headed. That comes from confidence. In the second half maybe we could have killed it earlier given the chances we created, but we take the three points.‚Äù

He underlined the significance of the comeback.

‚ÄúFor the first time this season, the team overturned a double deficit. That has to be highlighted. The growth we‚Äôve shown over the last month and a half paid off in the end.‚Äù

Finally, Chivu summed up the mentality he sees within his squad. ‚ÄúThis is a mature team that knows there are moments you have to overcome,‚Äù he concluded.

‚ÄúYou have to act according to the phase of the game. When you take two slaps like that, you don‚Äôt know how you‚Äôll react, but this group knows the difficulties. My demands are always very high. You shouldn‚Äôt point fingers at individual performances. I am responsible and I put my face to it. The lads work well, and you can see it.‚Äù

Inter‚Äôs six-goal response may have stolen the headlines, but Chivu‚Äôs words revealed a deeper satisfaction.

Beyond the scoreline, he saw proof of belief, accountability and a young striker determined to prove himself at the highest level.

title: Fact Check: Don't fall for rumor Jalen Hurts established Renee Good Hope Scholarship Fund
description: According to the rumor, the NFL's 2025 Super Bowl MVP donated $300,000 of his own money as a way of kick-starting the special fund.
fullText:
Philadelphia Eagles quarterback Jalen Hurts established the Renee Good Hope Scholarship Fund ‚Äî in honor of the woman fatally shot by an ICE agent in Minneapolis in January 2026 ‚Äîand contributed $300,000.

In January 2026, online users shared a rumor claiming Philadelphia Eagles quarterback Jalen Hurts established the Renee Good Hope Scholarship Fund. Users' posts claimed the NFL's Super Bowl LIX MVP kickstarted the fund himself, contributing $300,000 of his own money.

The purported scholarship fund referenced Renee Good, a 37-year-old Minneapolis resident shot fatally shot on Jan. 7 by U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement officer Jonathan Ross.

For example, on Jan. 20, a user managing the NFL Pulse Facebook page posted (archived) an image collage of three pictures allegedly showing Hurts hugging Good's 6-year-old son on a football field, Good holding her son in front of a body of water and Hurts walking inside a football stadium. The post's text claimed Good's killing inspired Hurts to launch the Renee Good Hope Scholarship Fund, including the $300,000 contribution.

In short, the rumor was false. One or more users fabricated and promoted the claim with the help of images and text generated with artificial-intelligence tools.

Snopes contacted a manager of the NFL Pulse Facebook page to ask about the fictional stories and AI-generated content displayed on the feed, as well as the Philadelphia Eagles to request an official statement, and will update this story if we receive more information.

The NFL Pulse Facebook post (archived) ‚Äî as well as other Facebook posts sharing the same rumor ‚Äî featured links leading to advertisement-filled articles hosted on WordPress blogs. The users owning those blogs earned revenue based on the combination of advertising and made-up stories. The NFL Pulse post redirected to an article on on such untrustworthy website.

Searches of Bing, DuckDuckGo and Google found no news media outlets reporting about Hurts establishing a scholarship fund in Good's name. A Yahoo search did, however, mistakenly produce an AI-generated answer wrongly confirming the rumor as true. Outlets would have widely reported on the story involving Hurts and Good, had it truly occurred.

Regarding the fake, AI-generated photo of Hurts holding Good's son, the most evident sign of AI ‚Äî¬†aside from the misspelling of "Eagles" as "Eaglees" ‚Äî was the reality that sports and standard news outlets would have very widely publicized the moment, had the meeting between the quarterback and young boy truly taken place.

The NFL Pulse Facebook post's text, presented in its entirety later in this article, featured over-dramatic wording common with AI tools. For example, one part of the post read, "This was not charity for attention. It was an act of remembrance, of dignity, and of deep human empathy ‚Äî a reminder that even in the aftermath of violence and loss, compassion can still speak louder than silence." Additionally, the idea that individuals or teams aiming to rapidly produce inauthentic content for ad revenue would carefully, slowly and manually write text for their articles simply does not square with reality.

The person or people who authored the story about Hurts and Good fabricated the entire claim as one of hundreds of inspirational tales that depicted celebrities and athletes performing inspiring acts of kindness. Such stories resemble glurge, which Dictionary.com defines as stories "that are supposed to be true and uplifting, but which are often fabricated and sentimental."

For readers interested in the story told in the NFL Pulse Facebook post, the post presented the made-up tale as follows:

Jalen Hurts has officially established The Renee Good Hope Scholarship Fund, personally committing an initial $300,000 donation to honor the life of Renee Nicole Good ‚Äî a mother whose story ended in tragedy after she was killed in Minneapolis, a loss that left an entire community grieving.

But this gesture goes far beyond a financial contribution.

Jalen Hurts founded the scholarship fund himself to ensure that Renee's 6-year-old son will receive full educational support from elementary school through college ‚Äî including tuition, books, tutoring, and opportunities for personal development. Alongside the financial commitment, Jalen also dedicated his voice, his platform, and his heart to a child now facing a world without his mother.

This was not charity for attention. It was an act of remembrance, of dignity, and of deep human empathy ‚Äî a reminder that even in the aftermath of violence and loss, compassion can still speak louder than silence.

Across the nation, many were moved not by the amount of money pledged, but by the meaning behind Jalen's decision: a promise that Renee Nicole Good's life mattered, and that her son's future will be protected, supported, and filled with hope.

For further reading, we previously reported about the time tech billionaire Elon Musk deleted a post supporting the Eagles supporting the Eagles after they lost the 2023 Super Bowl LVII.

"GLURGE Definition & Meaning." Dictionary.com, https://www.dictionary.com/browse/glurge.

Huberman, Bond, and David Emery. "Snopestionary: What Does 'Glurge' Mean?" Snopes, 21 Aug. 2021, https://www.snopes.com//articles/363643/what-does-glurge-mean/.

title: Chivu: Inter ‚Äòcould have collapsed‚Äô, Sommer‚Äôs mistake ‚Äòmy fault‚Äô
description: Inter coach Cristian Chivu is impressed by players‚Äô reaction in a 6-2 win over Pisa and defends Yann Sommer after the Swiss keeper gave away the opening goal: ‚ÄòIt‚Äôs my fault.‚ÄôInter came back f...
fullText:
Inter coach Cristian Chivu is impressed by players‚Äô reaction in a 6-2 win over Pisa and defends Yann Sommer after the Swiss keeper gave away the opening goal: ‚ÄòIt‚Äôs my fault.‚Äô

Inter came back from two goals down in a home game against Pisa on Friday. The Serie A giants completed the comeback even before the half-time break and then scored three 

MILAN, ITALY ‚Äì JANUARY 14: Cristian Chivu, Head Coach of FC Internazionale Milano, reacts during the Serie A match between FC Internazionale and US Lecce at Giuseppe Meazza Stadium on January 14, 2026 in Milan, Italy. (Photo by Marco Luzzani/Getty Images)

A turning point in the game came at minute 34 when Chivu replaced Luis Henrique with Federico Dimarco. The Italian was the Man of the Match, scoring one goal and providing one assist.

‚ÄúA match lasts 100 minutes, and it can be turned around,‚Äù Chivu told DAZN via FCInter1908.

Pisa striker Stefano Moreo scored the opening goal with a 30-yard lob, but Sommer gave the ball away outside the box, in an attempt to build up from the back.

‚ÄúThat was my fault because I‚Äôm the one who makes certain requests to the goalkeeper. Sometimes I put Yann in difficulty,‚Äù Chivu said.

‚ÄúThen they scored from a set piece. After that, we showed pride and kept pushing with quality and intensity, and we turned it around.

‚ÄúThe attitude is what matters; you might suffer at times, but what counts is how you react. I‚Äôd say we did very well,‚Äù Chivu continued.

‚ÄúWe could have collapsed, but instead, the team kept doing their things. The only regret is that we didn‚Äôt make it 4-2 earlier, only at the end. But hats off to the boys, they give everything they have to make this a competitive season and to show that we‚Äôre working to reach our objectives.‚Äù

Inter came back from two goals down in a home Serie A clash against Pisa, completing a comeback with Piotr Zielinski, Lautaro Martinez and Francesco Pio Esposito in the opening Round 22 match.

Pio Esposito gave Inter the lead seconds before the break with his third Serie A goal this season.

‚ÄúHe really wants to prove himself and put himself on the line. He takes responsibility, like all 25 of our players,‚Äù Chivu said.

‚ÄúAnd if things don‚Äôt go well, it will always be my fault because sometimes I push too hard. I‚Äôm happy they believe in our work.‚Äù

Chivu arrived late for his post-match interview as he required treatment from the Inter doctors.

‚ÄúI‚Äôve filled myself with painkillers for my back,‚Äù he revealed.

‚ÄúTomorrow, my kids want me fresh, and my wife expects it too. I have to be ready to be a good husband and a good father.‚Äù

Does this mean he won‚Äôt watch Juventus-Napoli and Roma-Milan on Sunday?

‚ÄúThat question again‚Ä¶I have a passion for football that goes beyond my job. Sometimes I‚Äôm tired because I watch so many matches, but I know you have to watch them to learn,‚Äù Chivu concluded.

‚ÄúIf I get the chance to watch them, I will, but my family is the priority because I devote too much time to these fantastic boys and often neglect my duty as a husband and father. And since they deserve it, sometimes, you have to switch off and not think too much about football. Family always comes first.‚Äù

title: ‚ùåFluminense won't sell: Kevin Serna won't be joining Boca
description: The bad news is piling up in the Ezeiza offices. After the definitive collapse of negotiations for Alexis Cuello, Boca Juniors has received another "no," this time from Brazil. Fluminense officially r...
fullText:
The bad news is piling up in the Ezeiza offices. After the definitive collapse of negotiations for Alexis Cuello, Boca Juniors has received another "no," this time from Brazil. Fluminense officially rejected the $5 million offer presented by the La Ribera club to acquire the services of Kevin Serna.

The Colombian forward, who is under contract with the "Flu" until December 2027, was declared non-transferable by the Carioca management, which considers the offer insufficient and prioritizes maintaining their structure for the 2026 season. With this rejection, Juan Rom√°n Riquelme loses his second priority option to strengthen the wing in less than 24 hours.

With the refusals for Serna and Cuello, Boca's offensive outlook now depends on parallel negotiations that must be accelerated. The only name that seems to be "close" is √Ångel Romero, who would arrive as a free agent. However, the Football Council ‚Äî now under the structure of Marcelo Delgado as manager ‚Äî is already considering other emergency names.

Among the alternatives gaining momentum are Rodrigo Auzmendi (Banfield) and the return of inquiries for Chimy √Åvila. Meanwhile, the pressure is on to secure at least one significant forward before the debut in the Torneo Apertura, considering that Claudio √öbeda's squad is facing significant injuries in the forward line.

title: üò±Atl√©tico Nacional deny James access to the training ground
description: Amid uncertainty about his professional future, James Rodr√≠guez's name once again became a trending topic in Medell√≠n. However, Atl√©tico Nacional stepped in to dispel the rumors, denying that the m...
fullText:
Amid uncertainty about his professional future, James Rodr√≠guez's name once again became a trending topic in Medell√≠n. However, Atl√©tico Nacional stepped in to dispel the rumors, denying that the midfielder had requested permission to train at the club's High Performance Center in Guarne.

Although the "number 10" is currently in the capital of Antioquia doing individual training, the "Verdolaga" management was emphatic in stating that there has been no formal contact from the player. According to local reports, the club has not received any requests to use its facilities, and James continues his preparation on his own while waiting for a concrete offer.

In addition to clarifying the training issue, Atl√©tico Nacional has definitively closed the door on a possible signing of James for the 2026 season. The club's reasons are strictly strategic and financial.

With Nacional out of the picture and Millonarios analyzing the viability of the "The Last Dance" plan, James is still racing against the clock to find a team and arrive in competitive shape for the 2026 World Cup.

fullText:
At long last Zuffa Boxing is set to kick off its debut event later TONIGHT (Fri., Jan. 23, 2026) as Zuffa Boxing 1 is set to go down inside Meta‚Äôs Apex in Las Vegas, Nevada. Headlining the event ‚Äî which will streaming live on Paramount+ ‚Äî will be a Middleweight showdown between Irish sensation, Callum Walsh, taking on Carlos Ocampo.

Walsh was Dana White‚Äôs first-ever signing to his upstart boxing promotion, so it makes sense to have him kickoff the debut event. ‚ÄúKing‚Äù is undefeated (15-0) with 11 knockouts and is coming off a unanimous decision win over Fernando Vargas Jr. on the ‚ÄúCanelo vs. Crawford‚Äù-led undercard in Las Vegas, Nevada, back in Sept. 2025 (full results here). As for Ocampo, he is coming in with a record of 38-3 and is currently riding a three-fight win streak into a bout he hopes will give him the spotlight should he pull off the massive upset.

It‚Äôs an important night for White and Co. since the debut fight card to his boxing venture will either silence a lot of doubters (such as this one), or give them more fuel to spit verbal venom at him for trying to change things up to a combat sport that has marched to the beat of the same drum for decades.

We don‚Äôt expect it to be perfect, but all eyes will be on this event.

Many readers check in before, during and after the fights to share their thoughts on all of the action, as the card kicks off at 6 p.m. ET on Paramount+. Feel free to leave a comment (or several) about the bouts and chat with all the other Maniacs during the show ‚Äî it‚Äôs always a lot of fun!
